title: Stars pay tribute to Bill Turnbull after journalist died aged 66 following battle with cancer
description: The  former BBC Breakfast presenter's family revealed that he died 'peacefully' at home in Suffolk after a 'challenging and committed fight' against his cancer.

title: Anthony Albanese opens up the floodgates to 195,000 new migrants
description: Anthony Albanese's government the permanent migration intake will rise from 160,000 to 195,000 for 2022-23.

title: 'Winter is coming': Kevin McCarthy gives stark warning from Biden's hometown of Scranton
description: Kevin McCarthy issued a stark warning to voters in remarks from Joe Biden's hometown of Scranton on Thursday by telling American families falling behind on their utility bills that 'winter is coming.'

description: The Today Show host asked Anthony Albanese to confirm reports he had given Mr Joyce a lift to the Jobs and Skills Summit at Canberra House.

title: Michael Gove will NOT pledge to back Liz Truss's budget if she wins Tory leadership

description: A hard-hitting United Nations report which strongly condemns China's treatment of Uyghur Muslims held in Xinjiang could lead to a criminal investigation in the Hague, it has been reported.

title: Two in five families are spending less money on groceries as prices at checkout soar, study shows
description: The changes in behaviour come as the price of staple foods rises by more than 10 per cent a year. Some 37 per cent have cut back on food spending, polling company Opinium found.

description: A majority in a new Wall Street Journal poll agrees that the FBI's Mar-a-Lago search 'was part of a legal and proper investigation,' but 41 per cent called it part of a 'witch hunt.'

description: Police yesterday faced demands to investigate an ex-murder suspect who won custody of his neighbours' toddler after duping social workers.

description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers raised fears on Thursday that a nuclear deal with Iran will weaken sanctions on the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps..

description: The video - which police allege was filmed by an accomplice -  shows a man in his 40s 'minding his own business' while sitting on Blackpool Promenade on Wednesday morning.

description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said former President Trump shoulders the blame for learning loss during Covid-19 closures for 'mismanaging the pandemic.'

Sen. Dennis Pyle, 61, was pulled over for speeding on April 2 in Hiawatha, Kansas by a Brown County Sherriff's officer.
In camera footage he can be heard saying he shouldn't be impeded.

description: Joe Biden will continue his attacks on 'extreme MAGA Republicans' on Thursday night in a primetime speech focusing on threats to democracy - the issue that he says prompted to him to run for president.

title: Moment police stop Gary Busey from leaving convention after he was accused of inappropriate touching
description: Cherry Hill, New Jersey police have released body camera footage showing at least two officers stopping actor Gary Busey, 78, from leaving the Monster Mania convention.

title: Vladimir WON'T attend Soviet leader's funeral on Saturday because he is 'too busy'
description: Russia's president is reportedly unable to go to Gorbachev's funeral because of his 'work schedule' according to his spokesman Dmitry Peskov.

title: Pope declares mankind is 'experiencing the outbreak of World War Three'
description: In his address to Polish-speaking pilgrims at the end of his weekly audience in the Vatican yesterday, the pontiff encourages prayers 'in a special way' for the people of Ukraine.

title: Anti-Putin businessman who fell to his death in DC said Russia was getting 'weaker every day'
description: Daniel Rapoport was found dead outside an apartment building in Washington DC on August 14 after apparently falling from the roof. His wife doesn't believe that he killed himself.

title: Lara Trump, Alina Habba knock FBI's messy classified documents photo
description: Allies of  Donald Trump are taking issue with the photograph released in court filings that shows classified documents strewn on the floor of what's presumably Mar-a-Lago.

title: Gallery sets out to buy 1776 painting of Polynesian who sailed to Britain with Captain Cook for £50m
description: The National Portrait Gallery has set out to buy a famed 1776 painting of a Polynesian man who sailed to Britain with Captain Cook and became the country's 'first non-white celebrity'.

title: Penny Wong condemns Beijing over 'human rights violations' against Uyghur Muslims
description: The Foreign Minister blasted Beijing after a bombshell UN report outlined the communist superpower's 'crimes against humanity' with its treatment of Uyghurs in the Xinjiang region.

title: SA mum and hairdresser Renae O'Bryan pleads guilty to selling meth in Whyalla
description: Mother-of-two, Renae Elma O'Bryan, 34, who had owned a hairdressing business is now facing time in jail after her life crumbled into despair, addiction and drug dealing.

title: Adele admits she scrapped her big-budget Las Vegas residency because it lacked intimacy
description: Reflecting on the moment she pulled the plug during an interview with ELLE, Adele, 34, admits the decision came as she performed a soundcheck at the cavernous venue.

title: Gary Barlow impersonator Mitchell Corner stalked ex-girlfriend and threatened to kill himself
description: Mitchell Corner, 29, met the woman through an online dating app in February this year and they went on several dates before she decided she was not interested.

title: Man, 41, accused of pulling a woman onto the tracks at King's Cross is remanded in custody
description: Arthur Hawrylewicz, 41, is alleged to have tried to kill Maria Osifeso in the horrific incident that took place on the Hammersmith and City Line on Monday.

title: Cops REOPEN case of woman stabbed 20 times that was ruled suicide to find her killer
description: Investigators are reviewing evidence from the crime scene of a 27-year-old teacher from Philadelphia that they said may have been staged to appear as a suicide nearly a decade ago.

title: Biden's diabolical student debt scheme robs the poor to give to the rich, writes INEZ STEPMAN
description: You can be outraged over President Joe Biden's politically craven debt forgiveness giveaway to his most loyal voters - and believe me - I am. But you must admit - it's rather diabolically clever.

title: The politically rotten FBI is riddled with anti-Trump, pro-Biden hooligans
description: Once again, it seems the FBI and the DOJ may be trying to convict Donald Trump in the court of cable news, rather than an actual courtroom. It's a shameful state of affairs.

title: Nurse in LA horror crash will remain in jail for another two weeks after bail hearing is delayed
description: Nicole Linton, 37, will now appear for her bail hearing on September 12, after a California judge granted prosecutors' motion to postpone today's hearing.

title: Scots schoolboy dies after 'attempting same TikTok blackout challenge as Archie Battersbee'
description: Schoolboy Leon Brown, of Cumbernauld, Scotland, was found unresponsive in his bedroom after reportedly attempting the same dangerous TikTok 'Blackout Challenge' trend as Archie Battersbee.

title: Tony Blair's son Euan's education start-up takes on universities by offering degrees for apprentices
description: An education start-up by Euan Blair is taking on universities by offering debt-free degrees for apprentices while they work at firms such as Rolls-Royce and Mastercard

title: Mourners arrive on gold horse-drawn carriages for funeral of Tyson Fury's cousin Rico Burton
description: Rico Burton, 31, was stabbed to death outside a bar in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, in the early hours of the morning of Sunday, August 21. Liam O'Prey, 21, has been charged with his murder.

title: New Jersey mom's agony after accidentally leaving girl, 2, to die in hot car
description: The parents of a two-year-old girl were heard wailing in anguish after police knocked on their door to tell them their infant had died in a hot car, where she had been left for seven hours.

title: British tourist is killed and another seriously hurt after scooter crashes into truck on Thai island
description: A 36-year-old British man and his friend, 30, are believed to have been drinking at a local bar on the island of Koh Samui before trying to ride back to their hotel in the early hours of Thursday.

title: Boris Johnson confirms £700m investment in Sizewell C nuclear power station
description: In what is expected to be his final major speech as Prime Minister, the outgoing premier said he was 'absolutely confident it will get over the line' in the next few weeks.

title: Teacher who was accused of having sex with pupil posts videos from life as yoga teacher in Dubai
description: Former teacher Melissa Tweedie, 27, built a new life for herself among ex-pats in the wealthy desert state of Dubai since losing her job at Gleniffer High School in Paisley, Renfrewshire.

title: Former BBC Breakfast host Bill Turnbull dies aged 66
description: Bill Turnbull's family said the ex-BBC Breakfast host died 'peacefully' at home in Suffolk yesterday after a 'challenging and committed fight against prostate cancer'.

title: Shocking moment 78-year-old woman is dragged out of taxi by the driver who proceeded to rob her
description: The 78-year-old woman had ordered the Access-A-Ride cab to take her to physical therapy, but became concerned when the driver continued past the destination and refused to let her out

title: Britain is urged to 'come clean' over claims a 'Canadian spy' smuggled Shamima Begum into Syria
description: There are growing calls for an inquiry into claims the Met knew the alleged people smuggler was responsible for helping Begum.

title: Bill Turnbull's Strictly Come Dancing partner Karen Hardy pays emotional tribute
description: Speaking in an interview on BBC News, Karen Hardy, 52, broke down as she spoke warmly of the star, calling him a 'gentleman' and 'mentor'.

title: Man, 20, was left in a coma after being stung by African killer bees 20,000 times
description: Austin Bellamy, 20, was in a medically induced coma Tuesday night, after he accidentally cut into the hive while doing tree work for a friend in Ohio. He has since woken up.

title: One million women changed or quit their jobs due to the menopause costing UK businesses £5billion
description: A million women in the UK have had to change their jobs or quit working because of a lack of support while going through the menopause, a leading expert has claimed.

title: NHS hospitals face paying an extra £2MILLION a month for energy this winter
description: Research published in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) estimates hospital gas and electricity costs to be up to three times higher than last year. Trusts may have to sacrifice patient care to afford it.

title: Anne Heche's eldest son, 20, applies to be in charge of the late star's estate
description: According to legal documents, 20-year-old Homer Heche Laffoon made the request in Los Angeles County Court this week to take control of his mother's fortune.

title: Ex-boyfriend of lottery winner, 40, who scooped £10,000-a-month jackpot fears she'll take DOGS away
description: EXCLUSIVE: Engineer Kirk Stevens, who was dumped by his girlfriend Laura Hoyle after she won the lottery, has told how he now fears she will take his beloved cocker spaniels off him too.

title: Don Lemon says he is 'shocked' by Meghan Markle's race admission
description: Meghan's comments came during her interview with Mariah Carey in the second episode of her Archetypes Spotify podcast, part of Meghan and Harry's $21m deal with the streaming giant.

title: City insurance law firm gives newly qualified lawyers a 60% pay rise - bumping salaries to £80,000
description: Bosses at Kennedys increased pay for its newly qualified lawyers from £50,000 to £80,000. It also raised salaries for its London trainees from £41,000 to £44,000.

title: Boris's last day as Prime Minister, REVEALED
description: The Queen will not travel to London to appoint the new prime minister next week. Instead, it was announced yesterday, she will conduct the ceremony at Balmoral - raising fresh concerns for her health.

title: Beijing sends 14 fighter jets across Taiwan Strait after Taipei's military shot down drone
description: The defence ministry said the jets (file image) crossed the unofficial territorial barrier in the sabre-rattling exercise as Beijing continues its activities near the island.

title: GMB reporter says there has 'definitely been a change in tone' in US coverage of Meghan Markle
description: Ross King MBE, who moved to America in 2000, suggested the timing of her interview with The Cut  and the row over remarks about Mandela had generated a reaction.

title: Man arrested on suspicion of murder after convicted paedophile, 77, dies after attack in Stroud home
description: John Coxon (pictured) died aged 77 two months after sustaining a serious head injury in a violent  attack in house on Park Road, Stonehouse, Gloucestershire, on January 12.

title: Texas officials make biggest bust in 20 years with $12million of cocaine disguised as baby wipes
description: They uncovered 1,935 packages containing 1,532.65 pounds of alleged cocaine within the shipment after bringing out the sniffer dogs and using a non-intrusive inspection system examination.

title: Cheshire mother punched son in the face after moving in with girlfriend who 'took him away from her'
description: Pauline Randles (pictured), 57, Neston, Cheshire started her campaign of harassment after becoming jealous over son PC Simon Randles moving in with his girlfriend in May last year.

title: Mothers take to patrolling park where 'teen gang' brutally attack their children
description: As many as eight parents in the town of Chorley, Lancashire, say their children have been attacked by the gangs in the last year. But they claim police are failing to take them seriously.

title: BrewDog CEO James Watt slams 'clueless' government as he announces closure of six bars
description: In an astonishing no-holds-barred post, James Watt, warned the UK's hospitality sector faced 'sheer rabbit in the headlights paralysis' from what he dubbed 'this zombie government'.

title: Domestic abuse victim, 22, reveals horrific injuries she suffered at hands of violent ex-boyfriend
description: A woman has revealed how her abusive ex-boyfriend raped her and beat her so badly, he broke her jaw. Morgan Matthews (pictured), 22, was subject to abuse by Emmanuel Richards, 42.

title: The cyber arms race: Bosses use spy software to monitor staff at home... while workers fight back
description: UK employers have turned to online tools and software to monitor employees' movements at home - even photographing them in real time and tracking their keyboard movements.

title: Kate Moss admits her adrenal glands and nervous system were 'f**ked'
description: The supermodel, 48, said she wanted to 'fix' them and embarked on the 12-steps to recovery programme, referencing the self-help tome, the Big Book.

title: Russia and China launch Vostok war games - but with far smaller numbers amid Ukraine invasion
description: The 50,000 Russian troops that are said to be taking part in the Vostok 2022 war games are just a fraction of the 300,000 that drilled alongside those from China and Mongolia four years ago.

title: Black troops view KKK plaque at West Point that congressional committee says is ok to keep up
description: The engraving at the storied military academy - situated in Upstate New York -  is part of massive mural depicting multiple elements of US history, on one of its oldest campus buildings.

title: Harry Styles has not purchased Grand Designs' saddest ever property in North Devon for £8million
description: The infamous lighthouse-inspired home that appeared on the 'saddest ever' episode of Grand Designs is still on the market.

title: Retired detective who helped find 'violent monster' accused of killing daughter calls for justice
description: Josephine Wentzel, 63 was determined to ensure that the case did not go cold. She worked ceaselessly until a woman in El Salvador read an article on the case  and recognized the killer.

title: Russell Brand faces backlash over plans for recording studio at Grade II-listed 15th century pub
description: Russell Brand, 47, (pictured) bought The Crown pub in the small village of Pishill, Oxfordshire for £850,000 in 2020 with plans to turn it into a vegan restaurant.

title: Outrage as Berkeley is now demanding students wear masks if they are not vaccinated against FLU
description: The move, which represents a doubling down on widely abandoned masking policies and challenges 2019 norms for flu, was met with a torrent of criticism on social media

title: Missing child was found inside drugs den filled with heroin and crack cocaine
description: Operation Scorpion, executed in Sheffield last week, resulted in seven arrests, included two people who were wanted by police. Five people were taken in on alleged drug related offences.

title: Father found he was bitten by false widow spider when 'football-sized' blister ballooned on his leg
description: Nathan Green feared he'd been spiked on a trip to a pub garden with pals - only to discover it was a horror reaction to a false widow spider bite when a 'football-sized' blister ballooned from his leg.

title: Harry and Meghan set to return to the UK after latest broadside at royals
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are returning to the UK for the first time since the Queen's Platinum Jubilee celebrations in early June.

title: 'This was an occupational hazard': Zoo keeper loses hand after alligator bit him during training
description: Greg Graziani, wildlife director of Florida Gator Gardens in Venus and an alligator veteran of 46 years, had his wrist chomped on August 17, the park reported on its Facebook page.

title: WA stripper Chad Satchell moves to have charges dropped for carrying fake gel blaster assault rifle
description: Chad Satchell, 31, was heading to his job as an exotic dancer when he unwittingly caused chaos on a Perth street on August 7 as armed police descended on him.

title: Police launch hunt for suspect after schoolgirl, 11, was sexually assaulted on path near a park
description: The young girl was walking through Stamshaw Park in Portsmouth around 4:30pm on Monday when she was assaulted. Police have released photos of the man suspected of the assault (pictured).

title: Rod Stewart pokes fun at himself after being compared to a grass-tufted fortified pillbox
description: Sir Rod Stewart, 77, (pictured) saw the funny side when fans compared him to an old bunker covered in long grass, sharing the photo with his 500,000 Twitter followers.

title: BrewDog employee tells how she was ordered to find dead squirrels for End of History beer
description: The beer, which was the world's strongest at 55 per cent alcohol, was released by the Scottish firm in 2010. Former employee Jenny Lane said it was the 'weirdest project' she ever worked on.

title: Lord Frost reveals he's in talks about standing to be a Tory MP - as he's tipped for Cabinet role
description: The Conservative peer admitted he was 'ambivalent' about being in the House of Lords as he spoke of his plans to move to the elected chamber.

title: Chairman of Russian oil company that criticised Putin's invasion dies after plunging from window
description: Ravil Maganov, 67, chairman of Russian oil giant LUKOIL, diedafter  falling from a window on the 6th floor of the Central Clinical Hospital in Moscow.

title: Youssef Assoum death: Second man is charged eight years after alleged gangland hit
description: A 44-year-old man arrested at a Georges Hall home early on Thursday is accused of trying to burn and destroy the victim's car. It comes after Comanchero Tarek Zahed was charged with murder.

title: Centrelink recipients in flood affected areas of Australia will have to start repaying their debts
description: Services Australia put debt repayment pauses in place to support Australians living in areas of the country hit by natural disasters this year.

title: Ukraine rains fire on Putin's invaders as Russian self-propelled gun and crew destroyed
description: Aerial footage shows the 2S3 Akatsiya self-propelled gun exploding into a huge fireball after it was hit by Ukrainian artillery.

title: Jake Fallon on sex offender register for five years for smacking  woman's bottom in nightclub
description: Jake Fallon, 30, pleaded guilty to sexual assault and is 'extremely embarrassed' about the 'one off incident' which occurred on the dancefloor of the Yates pub in Newcastle.

title: Woman unfairly fired after warning Concert Live boss that asking furloughed staff to WFH was illegal
description: EXCLUSIVE Sara Essa, 31, was sacked as Head of People at Concert Live Ltd in London after she refused to sign off when bosses wanted employees to work while on furlough, a tribunal was told.

title: Mint issues 50c coin with code to mark 75th year of spy agency Australian Signals Directorate
description: Would-be spies have been challenged to crack the code engraved on the back of a new 50c coin, which has been issued to celebrate the 75th anniversary of an intelligence agency.

title: Knox Grammar schoolboys to meet with Holocaust survivor
description: Jewish officials are calling for the entire Knox Grammar school to meet with a Holocaust survivor after antisemitic messages on a secret chat room were exposed.

title: Father reveals family's devastation after his son was stabbed to death day before 20th birthday
description: Oliver Freckleton was killed by a single stab wound at a house in Stretton, Burton on the day before what would have been his 20th birthday.

title: Chancellor Nadhim Zahawi admits he's 'deeply concerned' about people freezing this winter
description: With average energy bills set to rocket to £3,549 a year from next month, Nadhim Zahawi insisted 'there's nothing off the table' as ministers consider what extra support to provide.

title: Moment drug dealer, 26, was sent flying over his motorbike handlebars into bush during police chase
description: Drug dealer Jack Quick, 26, was sent flying over his handlebars into a bush  after sharply braking in a high-speed police chase through a village in Nottinghamshire (pictured).

title: Tesla owners go on HUNGER STRIKE in Norway in protest over multiple faults with their electric cars
description: The Norwegian Tesla owners are demanding action after they found a series of faults with their vehicles, from the car not starting to loose front seats and rust on paintwork.

title: The 'fat cat' rail bosses who are set to receive up to £4.2M in pay packages this year
description: Train bosses are in line to receive multi-million pound pay packages this year as passengers face record fare hikes, cancellations and strikes.

title: Met Office issues warnings for flooding as torrential rain and thunderstorms set to batter Britain
description: Today sees the beginning of autumn and a miserable start to the month as heavy rain and lightning is set to hit the UK over the next week. A month's worth of rain could fall in a day in parts of the country.

title: Pilot who died in airfield plane crash named as Falklands War officer, 59, who starred in BBC show
description: Chris Waddington, 59, died when his plane crashed into an airfield has been named as a Falklands war hero and Parachute Regiment veteran who recently starred in a BBC show.

title: Rapper woke after Notting Hill Carnival and found Boris Johnson 'at the foot of his bed'
description: The man has now been identified as aspiring rapper Zee Remayne, known by the stage name Splinter Sales, who revealed he was awoken at 6am to shouts of 'screaming' police.

title: Pictured: British woman arrested in Mexico for trying to smuggle ketamine into Cancun
description: The woman, identified by officials only as Jennifer L, was allegedly found with 13kg of ketamine hidden in packets and bottles in a double-bottom of her suitcase at Cancun International Airport.

title: Pharmacist who thought heavy period was caused by Covid booster jab diagnosed with leukaemia
description: Victoria Lang, 30, from North Lanarkshire, thought her heavy period was caused by a recent Covid booster jab but found out it was actually a sign that she had a rare form of leukaemia

title: Royal Navy shadows Russian warships off Ireland which are 'making a point to Britain'
description: According to navy sources, the group of Russian ships are believed to have been supporting the war in Ukraine. The Times reported that it is not known where the ships will next go.

title: Riley Higgins: Son of Mortgage Choice co-founder to remain in jail over alleged Sydney robbery
description: Riley Higgins, the son of millionaire Mortgage Choice co-founder Peter Higgins, will remain in custody for at least two more weeks after being accused of robbing a petrol station.

title: Perth neighbours' seven-year battle over 90mm brick wall and leaves dropping into a pool
description: An Australian judge has lamented 'not all neighbours get on' in Supreme Court documents  relating to a claim for damages by a family who alleged builders next door were a 'nuisance'.

title: Boris Johnson 'goes nuclear' as he prepares to sign off on first of EIGHT new atomic reactors
description: Boris Johnson will today sign off on the first of eight new nuclear power stations - and urge his successor to focus on shoring up the UK's energy supplies.

title: World's biggest cruise ship costing £1.2BILLION to be sold for scrap before it has set sail
description: Global Dream II was constructed by German-Hong Kong shipbuilding film MV Werften and was nearly finished when the company went bankrupt at the start of the year.

title: Russian missile launched from its own border city MISFIRES and slams into the ground
description: The strike was allegedly due to hit Kharkiv but fell down near residential buildings in the city where Kremlin weaponry is stored for attacks on Ukraine.

title: Mother reveals her despair at social workers and courts who let programmer take control of toddler
description: In the disturbing case, police turned up at the mother's home and took her son after the courts rubber-stamped a foster agreement with her forged signature.

title: Ryan Giggs' friend Gary Neville faces contempt of court action
description: The former England star has been referred to Attorney General Suella Braverman by Judge Hilary Manley over a remark seen as referring to Ryan Giggs' domestic violence trial.

title: Hard-left US senator Bernie Sanders rants about class war at RMT-organised rally
description: Hard-left American politician Bernie Sanders last night joined Labour MPs and militant union bosses to declare class war and urge workers to carry on striking.

title: Michael Gove laughs off claims he could become a newspaper editor as he vows to stay on as MP
description: The former Levelling Up Secretary was brutally fired from his Government role in July - just hours after he'd told Boris Johnson to quit amid the Tory revolt against his premiership.

title: Elegance expert reveals the 10 things you should NEVER do if you want to appear classy
description: Elegance and etiquette expert Anna Bey, who splits her time between London and Geneva, gave advice on the top mistakes people make which make them appear less elegant in a YouTube video.

title: Anthony Albanese's jobs summit hangs Aboriginal flag upside-down
description: The flag was displayed alongside the Australian and Torres Strait Islander flags at the meeting on Thursday at the meeting of government and business leaders with it's red half wrongly at the top.

title: The Source Bulk Foods Crows Nest, Sydney goes into liquidation, blames society
description: The small business said it was left with no other choice but to go into liquidation, partially blaming its troubles on society's waning interest in building 'authentic' connections.

title: Chris Dawson's daughter Shanelle shares cryptic post after he was convicted of murdering Lyn Dawson
description: The couple's daughter, Shanelle Dawson, who was just four-years-old when her mother Lyn vanished, has not been in court for her father's trial but appeared to address the case on Wednesday.

title: Malcolm Turnbull abused by socialist activists during a disastrous appearance at Sydney University
description: Malcolm Turnbull was interrupted by shouting, chanting Socialist Alliance protesters who stormed his appearance at Sydney University's law speaker series on Thursday just after 1pm.

title: Burning Man-goers parade their extreme cars and bikes while others bake pizzas in 100F heat
description: The weeklong festival, held in Nevada since the 1990s, has long been a tradition frequented by individuals looking to let loose and enjoy the event's characteristically psychedelic atmosphere.

title: Covid fines challenged NSW Supreme Court: Protesters threatened with jail as sporting events allowed
description: A NSW Supreme Court test case has taken on two of some 40 people fined in breach of specific public health orders preventing public gatherings of more than 20 people, bar some exceptions.

title: Tyson Fury's masseur, 27, who was caught texting behind the wheel is SPARED a driving ban
description: Boxer Tyson Fury's official masseur Matthew Towey, 27, has been spared a driving ban after telling a court that he needed his car so he could continue treating the retired world heavyweight champion.

title: Huge changes coming to Australia's $1 billion cosmetic surgery industry after a MAJOR review
description: A scathing independent report found unsafe practices, misleading advertising and substandard marketing in Australia's cosmetic surgery industry.

title: TOM LEONARD: Is America falling out of love with the 'Petulant Princess' of Montecito?
description: TOM LEONARD: Some industry insiders have wondered whether the couple are struggling to find anything noteworthy to say beyond their split with the Royal Family.

title: Today show's Karl Stefanovic slams Knox Grammar students over secret chatroom messages
description: Karl Stefanovic has expressed fury over 'sick' chatroom messages by students from one of Australia's most elite private schools on Sydney's upper north shore.

title: Crackdown on NHS bureaucrats costing taxpayers £2.8billion a year: Steve Barclay launches plan
description: Mr Barclay will reveal that there are 18,600 people working in national NHS management bodies - none of whom provides patient care - costing a record £1.3 billion every year.

title: Biscuits, sweets, and sausages 'increase men's risk of bowel cancer', new study suggests
description: Ultra-processed foods - including instant soup and noodles and sweet or savoury packaged snacks - have been linked to higher rates of the disease, researchers said.

title: Queensland child killer could be denied right to apply for parole under strict new laws
description: Convicted murderer Alan William Craig may bear the brunt of 'the toughest parole laws in the nation', with the child killer likely labelled a 'restricted prisoner' blocking his efforts to be freed.

title: Prince Charles guest edits The Voice and says he's 'grateful' to African and Carribean communities
description: Prince Charles has guest edited the 40th anniversary edition of The Voice newspaper, which also features commentary from Baroness Doreen Lawrence and Hollywood actor Idris Elba.

title: Man accused of shooting Dutch commando was 'looking for trouble'" Friends say he 'flipped out'
description: Shamar Duncan and friends were 'looking for trouble' the night he is accused of fatally shooting a Dutch soldier and injuring two others in  Indianapolis.

title: Ellume Limited voluntary administration: Biotech company and rapid antigen test giant goes under
description: Australian biotech giant Ellume Limited has gone into voluntary administration. It comes after the company dealt with a number of false-positives and stock recalls for their Covid tests.

title: Toowoomba council worker caught allegedly luring cat from yard to put it in the pound on CCTV
description: A Queensland council worker has been caught allegedly luring a cat from its owners' property to impound it under an animal control law, after visiting the house over the number of pets kept there.

title: Mining magnate Andrew Twiggy Forrest buys Le Fanu mansion at Cottesloe, Perth
description: Mining tycoon Andrew 'Twiggy' Forrest has been confirmed as the buyer of the stunning Le Fanu residence in the trendy beachside Perth suburb of Cottesloe.

title: WA Police destroy illegal alcohol on its way into the Fitzroy Valley, alcohol-restricted zone
description: The Western Australia Police Force shared photos on Thursday of officers destroying illegal alcohol by running over the bottles and cans with an excavator.

title: Ben Fordham slams politician calling for shark nets to be removed
description: A Central Coast MP supports the removal of nets just a day after a teen surfer was bitten on the arm by what was believed to be a great white shark at nearby North Avoca

title: 'Cocaine' Cassie Sainsbury confesses to her Colombian drug crime in bombshell Channel 7 interview
description: 'Cocaine' Cassie Sainsbury admitted to trying to sneak drugs past Colombian airport security in a tell-all interview set to air on Channel 7 on Sunday.

title: Tash Peterson Sydney PETA protest: Notorious activist lies nearly naked in human-sized MEAT TRAY
description: WARNING - GRAPHIC CONTENT: Animal rights activist Tash Peterson has taken part in a disturbing protest where she pretended to be a piece of meat in Sydney's busy Pitt St Mall.

title: EY worker death: TikTok Aussie blasts toxic' work culture at Big 4 consulting firms
description: Many past and present workers have spoken out about their experiences working at the Big 4 firms, claiming the stressful work culture prompts many to leave after just a couple of years.

title: 'Hurricane season is heating up!' Scientists urge Americans not to be complacent
description: An unusually quiet August for tropical storms and hurricanes - only the third without either since 1961 - could be followed by an intense September, scientists have warned.

title: Country music singer Luke Bell battled severe bipolar disorder for years before going missing
description: Luke Bell's manager has revealed how he suffered from bipolar disorder at the time of his death. The 32-year-old country star had been reported missing for nine days before he was found in Tucson, Arizona.

title: Sydney commuter caught performing rapid antigen test on the train
description: A Sydney commuter has been caught performing an unusual activity while onboard a train as a fellow traveller took a photo of him undertaking a rapid antigen test.

title: Simone Holtznagel stalking charge: Fan denies following the Playboy model
description: Benjamin Reeves, 58, did not appear in Waverley Local Court on Thursday after being charged with stalking Simone Holtznagel with the intention of causing fear of physical or mental harm.

title: Girl, 5, found dead in 'pool of blood' as her brother, 8, fights for life after father 'shot them'
description: Jermaine Bass, 30, of Tampa, Florida was charged with first degree murder, first degree attempted murder after he claimed he 'accidentally' shot his children multiple times as they lay in bed

title: Bodycam footage shows shocking moment cops kill unarmed man in BED after mistaking vape pen for gun
description: Donovan Lewis, 20, was in bed in a Columbus, Ohio apartment when police arrived shortly before 3am, seeking to serve a felony arrest warrant for domestic violence, assault, and weapons-related incidents.

title: Jared Kushner appears sprightly after thyroid cancer operation at Mayo Clinic in Wisconsin
description: Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law has had a second successful surgery to treat an apparent recurrence of thyroid cancer at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota.

title: Ryan Giggs may have to wait a YEAR to try to clear his name
description: The former Manchester United player, 48, was accused of using coercive and controlling behaviour against ex-girlfriend Kate Greville.

title: Gov Abbott busses 100 to Democrat-led Windy City after forking out $12million on trips to NYC and DC
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced the state had sent the first bus of 100  migrants to Chicago on Wednesday. Abbott has previously bussed migrants to Washington, D.C. and NY.

title: Cops hunt lusty couple accused of performing LEWD SEX ACT at Athletics game in Oakland
description: Clearer footage has been unearthed of a man in a black shirt and woman wearing pink pants as they made their way towards the Oakland A's stadium at the weekend.

title: Dream home bought with $10m from Crypto.com bungle left to the weeds at Cragieburn
description: The dream home of a couple who bought it on the back of a $10.4million Crypto-transfer bungle has been left to the weeds.

title: BBC calls Nasa's Artemis moon rocket 'uncrewed' not 'unmanned' to avoid causing offence
description: During a news roundup on the Today programme, Alan Smith described an 'uncrewed' flight scheduled as part of NASA's moon mission.

title: Chris Dawson is bombarded with death threats just hours after being locked up
description: Wife killer Chris Dawson returned to court just two days after he was convicted of murdering Lynette Dawson in 1982, but his smart suit had been replaced with prison greens.

title: Family's tribute to artist who was brutally murdered by her own BROTHER with a hammer
description: A court was told on Thursday that Gabriella Delaney, 20, was repeatedly hit in the head with a hammer by her elder brother Lucas, an 'extensive' drug user.

title: Airbnb scam warning issued to Aussies, WA police refuse to investigate fraudster staying next door
description: A man was 'astonished' WA police refused to investigate when he told them someone was staying in a luxury villa two minutes from their station after allegedly hacking his Airbnb account.

title: Australia's business and political leaders unite in Canberra
description: Anthony Albanese has launched his Jobs and Skills summit with over 140 of Australia's biggest business leader set to hash out the problems facing Australia's workforce.

title: Inside the weird world of Chris Dawson and his identical twin
description: Chris and Paul Dawson are identical twins but their bond goes beyond being brothers. Now they will have to adjust to life without each other after Chris was found guilty of murdering his first wife.

title: Collins Trucks driver ploughs into a flock of sheep in Adelaide
description: Gruesome footage from a regional South Australian road shows a truck driver ploughing through a massive flock of sheep at night - with hundreds of dead livestock left in its wake.

title: Anthony Albanese faces calls to bring forward cheaper childcare
description: The new Labor government will increase childcare subsidy rates for every family earning less than $530,000, costing taxpayers $5.4 billion over four years.

title: Teen, 19, punched in FACE by cop appears in court
description: Tamani Crum wore a mask, white top and grey cardigan as she was arraigned in Manhattan Criminal court on Wednesday night.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith missing front tooth in Sydney airport appearance ahead of defamation trial outcome
description: Aussie war hero Ben Roberts-Smith, who is awaiting the judgement in his epic defamation case, arrived at Sydney International Airport missing one of his front teeth.

title: Woman who killed disabled bystander in NYC hit-and-run actually targeting her boyfriend's sister
description: Kiani Phoenix, 26, the woman charged with mowing down a disabled man when she sped down the sidewalk in her car was actually aiming at the sister of her 'abusive' ex-boyfriend, her lawyer said

title: Property prices: House values drop in every capital city except Darwin
description: CoreLogic's latest national Home Value Index shows four straight months of plunging Australian property prices, with the combined capital cities median price down 1.6 per cent for August.

title: Indiana man charged with rape of sorority girl, 20, after 'plying her with cannabis and alcohol'
description: Eric Montgomery, 33, Bloomington, Indiana man has been arrested and charged with the rape of Avery McMillan, 20, an intoxicated University of Indian sorority sister who later died

title: Weather: Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide Urgent warning over rare weather event
description: Australians can expected another summer of torrential rain and devastating flooding with the United Nations predicting a rare La Nina 'triple-dip'.

title: Trump responds to bombshell DOJ Mar-a-Lago court filing
description: The ex-president's legal team is hitting back at the DOJ's arguments against appointing a special master to oversee the classified documents recovered from Mar-a-Lago by the FBI.

title: Nikolas Cruz's jailhouse calls reveal he LAUGHED about leaving MAGA hat on adopted mother's grave
description: Nikolas Cruz laughed about leaving a MAGA hat on his adoptive-mother's grave as a postmortem prank, according to a summary of a jailhouse conversation released during his sentencing trial

title: Adelaide family say Queensland Whitsundays resort Daydream Island is a rip off
description: An Adelaide family have slammed the Whitsundays resort Daydream Island as a 'rip off' after they found their room mouldy, pools filthy and beaches void of sand.

title: Female snooker star calls for trans competitors to be banned from the sport after Jamie Hunter's win
description: Jamie Hunter (pictured), 25, of Widnes, Cheshire, is the first transwoman to win a ranking tournament on the women's circuit with a 4-1 score against Rebecca Kenna in Seattle.

title: Many of the sketch characters that brought me to stardom would have to be woke now, Lenny Henry says
description: Many of the sketch characters that brought Sir Lenny Henry stardom would have to be woke now, the comedian has declared. He insisted he'd do things differently if he was starting now.

title: Diana 'wouldn't have been a fan' of Meghan 'like she may think' reveals Tina Brown
description: Tina Brown said she thinks the Princess of Wales would have seen the former actress as someone who is 'steering Harry in a direction that was not good for' the Prince.

title: Scots aristocrat accused of sex assault claims he thought she consented
description: Euan Tennant, 39, is said to have attacked the woman as the pair lay in bed along with a friend at the Glen House mansion near Innerleithen, Peeblesshire, in July 2019.

title: Vegan zealots vow to paralyse UK's MILK supplies - risking price surges during cost of living crisis
description: Britain's milk deliveries could be under threat from a group of vegan campaigners who are threatening to disrupt supplies in a bid to force families to use plant based alternatives

title: Man charged with attempted murder after schoolgirl, 13, and woman, 35, were stabbed in Sheffield
description: A 30-year-old man has been charged with two counts of attempted murder after  a schoolgirl and woman were found with multiple stab wounds.

title: DAILY MAIL COMMENT: A crucial victory over family court secrecy
description: DAILY MAIL COMMENT: Although there have been efforts to make our notoriously secretive family courts more transparent, this appalling saga shows there's a long way to go.

title: Liz Truss signals she will BAN smart motorways if she becomes next PM after string of deaths
description: Liz Truss last night pledged to examine whether motorway speed limits should be scrapped if she becomes prime minister. She said she would 'look into' the radical proposal.

title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Sir Nick Clegg's wife has taken FOURTEEN trips this summer
description: RICHARD EDEN: The former deputy prime minister's wife, 54, has used Instagram, the website owned by Meta (formerly called Facebook), to share snaps of her numerous journeys.

title: Girl raped at 13 will have to wait nearly three years for justice because of pandemic court backlogs
description: The father of a girl who was raped aged 13 has spoken of his family's devastation that court delays mean she has been waiting two years for her case to be heard. The girl was raped in July 2020.

title: Win for sports team gives longer-lasting happiness than words 'I love you', research finds
description: Declarations of love from a romantic partner made people feel good for four hours on average, in a study of 2,000 adults. But victory for your team gave a warm feeling lasting nine minutes longer.
